member.name: T:Hydrobase.DataSetCollection
member.summary: This collection of datasets

member.name: M:Hydrobase.DataSetCollection.Add(System.Data.DataSet)
member.summary: this adds the given dataset to the collection
member.param: the dataset that you want to add

member.name: M:Hydrobase.DataSetCollection.SelectDataSet(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the Existed dataSet with thegiven name
member.param: the name of the dataset
member.returns: the Existed dataSet with thegiven name or null if doesnt exist or an error occured

member.summary: Returns the Existed dataSet with thegiven index
member.param: the index of the dataset
member.returns: the Existed dataSet with thegiven index or null if doesnt exist or an error occured

member.name: M:Hydrobase.DataSetCollection.IndexOf(System.Data.DataSet)
member.summary: Returns the index of the given dataset from the collection
member.param: the dataset that you are searching for.
member.returns: index of the given dataset from the collection, -1 if didn't find it or -2 if an exception occured.

member.name: M:Hydrobase.DataSetCollection.IndexOf(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the index of the dataset with the given name from the collection
member.param: the name of the dataset that you are looking for
member.returns: index of the dataset with the given name from the collection, -1 if didn't find it or -2 if an exception occured.

member.name: M:Hydrobase.DataSetCollection.Remove(System.Data.DataSet)
member.summary: Removes the given dataset from the collection
member.param: the dataset that you want to remove.

member.name: M:Hydrobase.DataSetCollection.Contains(System.Data.DataSet)
member.summary: Checks if the given dataset exists in the collection
member.param: the dataset that you are searching for.
member.returns: true if the dataset has been found or false if didn't or an exception occured.

member.name: T:Hydrobase.Maintenance_Backup
member.summary: \author Paris Koutsioukis (Angarato Surion) \brief This class handles the everything about File System handling ( Creates and removes folders also copies files) and bakup.

members.member: the constant that includes the name of the backup's folder

member.name: M:Hydrobase.Maintenance_Backup.CreateFolder(System.String)
member.summary: Creates the given folder with given name. Note: it considers the name of the new directory as the last directory in the given path
member.param: the path of the directory that will create

member.name: M:Hydrobase.Maintenance_Backup.CopyFile(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Copies a file from it's begining position to a new one.
member.param: the begining position of the file
the target position of the file

member.name: M:Hydrobase.Maintenance_Backup.CreateBackupofDB(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a Backup of the given database
member.param: the originalfolder that the database exists
the extension of the files that will be copied
the folder that will be saved .
the name of the database
member.returns: Returns the path of the backup

member.name: M:Hydrobase.Maintenance_Backup.RecoverBackupStpB(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: This method starts the 2nd part (and final step)of the backup process it recovers the databse back to it's original position
member.param: path of the backup folder
path of the originals database oflder
member.returns: 1 if succefully finished , 0 if nothing happened and -1 if an exception had been thrown.

member.name: M:Hydrobase.Maintenance_Backup.RecoverBackupStpB2(System.String,System.String)
member.returns: path of restored tables

member.name: M:Hydrobase.Maintenance_Backup.RecoverBackupStpA(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: This method starts the 1st step of the recovery process it's shows a message box with the list of the existed backups
member.param: path of the backup folder
path of the database
name of database
member.returns: path of the backup

member.name: M:Hydrobase.hydrobaseADO.UpgradeDataBase(System.Data.DataTable,System.Data.DataTable)
member.summary: Upgrades the table file format. for example if you made another xml file with your new cells in it, just use this method to put them in the old table. Note: It can be used as away to import the contents of another table or xml file.
member.param: the datatable that contains the new cells of the table
the datatable that the changes will take place.

member.name: M:Hydrobase.hydrobaseADO.FindApplicationInfo(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Searchs the info of the application that previusly accesed this table.
Note:Usualy the info i written in the ed of the file.
member.param: the path of the file to be searched
put 1 for searching in the start of the file or 2 for searching in the end.
member.returns: the application's information that is been written in the file or null if nothing happens or an exception is thrown.

member.name: M:Hydrobase.hydrobaseADO.DataBaseCreation(System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Creates the database (folder) that will include the table
Wairning: the complete path of the databae it will be path_untilDatabse +\+ DataBaseName Note: in the path_untilDatabse you put the path of the folder that will contain the databse.
member.param: the name of the database that will be created
the folder that will contain the database

member.name: M:Hydrobase.hydrobaseADO.GetTimeAndDateTableLastUpdated(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the time and date of table's last update.
member.param: the path of the table
member.returns: the time and date of table's last update. the first(or zero) element is the date and the second is the time. if an exception is thrown it returns null.

member.name: M:Hydrobase.hydrobaseADO.GetTableVersion(System.String)
member.summary: Get's (reads) the version of the table from the given filename.
member.param: the path of the file that contains the info about the vrsion of the table Note: In path the name of the file must be the same with the table's file. Their difference will be in their file extension
member.returns: Get's (reads) the version of the table from the given filename.

member.name: M:Hydrobase.hydrobaseADO.SetTableVersion(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: This set's the info about the version of the given file name and save it's to a new file with a diferent file extension.
member.param: the path of the file that will contain the info about the vrsion of the table Note: In path the name of the file must be the same with the table's file. Their difference will be in their file extension
a string that will indicate the new version of the table . example something like 1.0.0.0
a string that willl indicate the new build id or code of the table's version. example something like 11130 or word like silver cat
